intro: Reimaria aberrans, commonly known as the aberrant reindeer moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branched structure and small, elongated leaves that are often covered in a layer of rhizoids. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores when mature. Reimaria aberrans plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
